div.l: And bonde her hors / it sholde no more go loos
And in his owne chambre he made a bed
With shetes ⁊and wᵗith chalons fayre yspred
Nought from his owne bed ten fote or twelue
His doughter hadde a bed al by her selue
Right in the same chambre by
It myght be no bet and cause why
Ther was no rowmer herberwe in the place
They soupen and they speken hem to solace
And drynken ever stronge ale atte beste
Aboute mydnyght wente they to reste
Wel hath this Meller / vernysshed his heed
Ful pake he was for dronken / and noght reed
He ȝixeth and he speketh thurgh the nose
As he were on the quakke / or on the pose
To bed he goth and with hym goth his wyf
As eny iay she light was and iolyf
So was hir ioly whistel wel ywette
The cradel atte hir beddes feet is ysette
To rokken / and to yeve the childe to souke
And whan that dronken was al in crouke
To bedde wente the doughter right anoon̄
To bedde goth Aleyn̄ and also Iohn
Ther was no more hem neded no dwale
The meller hath so wysely bibbed ale
That as an hors / he snorteth in his sleep
Ne of his tayle ende / ne taketh he no keep
His wyf bar hym a burdon̄ a ful strong
Men myghte her routyng here a forlong
The wenche routeth eke ꝑpar companie
Aleyn the Clerk / that herde this melodye
He powked Iohn / and seide slepistow
Herde thou ever slyk a sang as now
Lo swilk a couplyng is amonges thaym alle
A wylde fyre / on thayre bodyes falle
Who herked eủere swilk a ferly thyng
Ȝe they sal have the floure of ille endyng
This lange nyght ther tides me na reste
